sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Methamphetamine Precursor Control Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Methamphetamine Precursor Control Act.

sections.heading: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to reduce the harm that methamphetamine manufacturing and manufacturers are inflicting on individuals, families, communities, first responders (including, but not limited to, emergency medical dispatchers), the economy, and the environment in Illinois, by making i
sections.text: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to reduce the harm that methamphetamine manufacturing and manufacturers are inflicting on individuals, families, communities, first responders (including, but not limited to, emergency medical dispatchers), the economy, and the environment in Illinois, by making it more difficult for persons engaged in the unlawful manufacture of methamphetamine and related activities to obtain methamphetamine's essential ingredient, ephedrine or pseudoephedrine. It is the intent of the General Assembly that this Act operate in tandem with and be interpreted as consistent with federal laws and regulations relating to the subject matter of this Act to the greatest extent possible.

sections.heading: Restrictions on purchase, receipt, or acquisition.
sections.text: Restrictions on purchase, receipt, or acquisition.

sections.heading: Preemption and home rule powers
sections.text: The regulation of the sale of targeted methamphetamine precursors and targeted packages are exclusive powers and functions of the State. A county or municipality, including a home rule unit, may not regulate the sale of targeted methamphetamine precursors and targete

sections.heading: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.
sections.text: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.

sections.heading: The Methamphetamine Precursor Retail Sale Control Act is repealed.
sections.text: The Methamphetamine Precursor Retail Sale Control Act is repealed.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect January 15, 2006.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect January 15, 2006.
